statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -2 \\ 4 \\ -2 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 5 \\ 5 \\ 5 \\ -6 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -6 \\ -18 \\ 16 \\ -16 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -13 \\ -9 \\ -21 \\ 20 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 5 \\ -6 \\ -5 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -2 \\ 4 \\ -2 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 5 \\ 5 \\ 5 \\ -6 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -6 \\ -18 \\ 16 \\ -16 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -13 \\ -9 \\ -21 \\ 20 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 5 \\ -6 \\ -5 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
